results.title: Ludovic: the snow gift
results.creator_credit: Therese Descary, French Program Animation, ONF | NFB and Youth Studio Program
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear who lives in a thatched cottage with his family watches the snow outside and dreams of tobogganing with his friends. His parents tell him he is too little, and Ludovic feels lonely, so he invents wonderful games to share with his new found friend, a doll that came to life.

results.title: Ludovic: magic in the air
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Jean-Jacques Leduc and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: From the much loved series for young children Ludovic, ‘Magic in the air’, tells a story with puppet animation about the magic of new friends. Ludovic happily plays in the playground when another teddy tries to befriend him, or so he thinks until he is knocked to the ground. Ludovic is rescued by a smiling girl teddy. Suddenly their is magic in the air and Ludovic and his new friend find ways to out-smart the bully. The leaves, the trees and even the sand castle help out and soon the bully leaves him alone. But the magic doesn’t stop and soon magic is used to help cheer up the mad and sad bully. Co Hoedeman who animated, directed and co-wrote this animation blends love with wonderment to create an affectionate story about friendship for kids of all ages. Website Link: www.nfbkids.ca/ludovic

results.title: Ludovic: a crocodile in my garden
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Jean-Jacques Leduc, Therese Descary, Animation Youth Studies, French Program and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear organises his origami jungle animals to go on a spring picnic in his garden. The mood degenerates as the animals disobey Ludovic and fight one another. Ludovic retreats inside disappointed, but all is resolved happily when cookies are distributed and the animals learn to share.

results.title: Lucy, queen of comedy
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, stills, film excerpts and trailers, and television program footage this video puts together an excellent documentary about the career of one of America’s most loved comedic entertainers and actors, Lucille Ball. From radio to motion pictures to eventually television where Lucy, partnered by her husband Desi Arnaz, starred in what is considered America’s all-time favourite television series, “I Love Lucy”. She has also starred with such actors as Eddie Cantor, the Three Stooges, the Marx Brothers, Bob Hope and Henry Fonda. Narrated by Jeff Lupeton.

results.title: Lucrezia Borgia
results.brief_description: Gaetano Donizetti’s opera “Lucrezia Borgia”, based on the play by Victor Hugo, is a story of love and intrigue set in 16th Century Italy. A young man, Gennaro, meets the despised Lucrezia Borgia (Joan Sutherland) and is attracted to her. Lucrezia’s husband, Alfonso, is jealous and plots his revenge on Gennaro. Just before he dies from poisoning, Lucrezia tells Gennaro that she is his mother. She too drinks poison and dies with him. A superb performance by the Australian Opera, directed by George Ogilvie and conducted by Richard Bonynge, and featuring the wonderfully rich voice of Joan Sutherland - this is a must for opera fans. Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on July 8, 1977 and sung in Italian.

results.title: Lucretia: a poem by Peter Desbarats
results.creator_credit: Heidi Blomkvist, Eunice Macaulay and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Bright, impish Lucretia is a perfect angel in her homeland, Hell, where good is frowned upon. One Christmas Eve she uses her magical powers to pass through the forbidden gate. Seeking Christmas throughout the galaxies, she finds the planet Earth and an old man’s snowy yard. The combined knowledge, yearning and powers of Lucretia and the old man produce a memorable Christmas celebration. Based on a poem by Peter Desbarats.

results.title: Luckytown blues
results.brief_description: Fleeing her trailer trash mother, 18 year old Lidda (Kirsten Dunst) calls into a video store to invite a guy she has seen from afar on a road trip with her to Las Vegas. Colonel (Vincent Kartheiser) begrudgingly accompanies her after he is left with no choice when she saves his life. Predictable bickering ensues and the two are destined for romance, especially when circumstance continues to pit them together. Las Vegas is a dazzling, sleazy, drug infested milieu populated by scantily clad women, prostitutes, and is home to Lidda’s estranged professional poker playing father (James Caan) with whom she seeks a reunion. In Vegas Lidda and Colonel do what it takes to survive: Colonel with gambling, Lidda with stripping, as they become embroiled in the dangerous world of her father in seeking answers at a crossroad in her life. Cast also includes: Luis Guzman, Robert Miano, Jennifer Gareis, Theresa Russell.

results.title: Luckily I need little sleep
results.brief_description: Kathy worked as a nurse in Greece and then came to Canada. She and her family live in northern Alberta, where they are developing a farm. Kathy works outside the home as a nurse, sews for the children, maintains the house, and helps with the farm work.

results.title: Lucia di Lammermoor = Lucia of Lammermoor by Donizetti
results.creator_credit: E. Cancellieri, George Richfield, Official Films and Richfield Operatic Films
results.brief_description: Donizetti’s tragic opera featuring members of the Scala of Milano and the Opera House of Rome with musical arrangement and script by Raffaele Gervasio and starring Anna Lollobrigida as Lucia.

results.title: Lucia di Lammermoor
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, John Copley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland brings to life Donizetti’s tragic heroine who murders her bridegroom on their wedding night. This breathtaking production by the Australian Opera also features Richard Greager and Malcolm Donnelly. The production was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, February 8, 1986.
